}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== [http://www.scsconnect.com/pdf/products/WLAN/LA5127.pdf Spec. sheet on '''scsconnect.com''']
[https://docs.symbol.com/KanisaPlatform/Publishing/763/11506_f.html LA5127 / LA5137 Linux Release 2.0.0.0-020LR] ('''requires Enterprise Mobility Services w/ Motorola''')
Docs for the LA-51XX series on the '''Symbol''' site.. *[https://docs.symbol.com/manuals/10439401a.pdf Linux Driver User's Guide] **module name: '''sm_drv_pc16''' **firmware name: '''53821ahif_sh.wrm''' *[https://docs.symbol.com/manuals/10439201a.pdf Driver Programmer's Guide] *[https://docs.symbol.com/manuals/10439101a.pdf API Programmer's Reference Guide] *[https://docs.symbol.com/manuals/10439601a.pdf Fusion Integration Guide]
This device is assumed to use CX53822-32Z. The '''32-Z''', however, is the only visible portion in the FCC photos. :Per the ''manual'', the code name of the hardware / platform appears to be '''Photon'''. The testing is indicated to have been done on a Windows CE 5.0 platform w/ '''Conexant''''s Manufacturing and Test Upper MAC driver (MTUM). Two SKUs for the LA-5127 family are noted in the ''manual''... *LA-5127-1002 - external antenna version *LA-5127-1020 - internal antenna version Additional information the the manual.. *The '''Conexant''' MAC/BB has an ARM946E core. *It is indicated that this chipset uses a ZIF radio architecture. *An internal Linux driver for the device existed (requiring kernel 2.4.22 +). **Targeted for Red Hat 9, sources and firmware were distributed **'''getoid''' and '''setoid''' configuration and monitoring tools
The FCC sample label and the label affixed to the device in the C2PC made 09/27/2010 indicate that the device uses a 00:15:70 ('''Symbol''') OUI.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
